snippet: After performing the New York premiere of Thomas Adès’s “Polaris: Voyage for Orchestra,” the New York Philharmonic, conducted by Alan Gilbert, offered a moving account of Mahler’s Ninth Symphony.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reviews concert of works by Mahler and premiere of Thomas Ades piece Polaris: Voyage for Orchestra performed by the New York Philharmonic Orchestra at Avery Fisher Hall.
lead_paragraph: After performing the New York premiere of Thomas Adès’s “Polaris: Voyage for Orchestra,” the New York Philharmonic, conducted by Alan Gilbert, offered a moving account of Mahler’s Ninth Symphony.

headline.seo: New York Philharmonic Performs Mahler and Thomas Adès - Review
headline.main: Sailing a Sea Teeming With Sonic Treasures
headline.print_headline: Sailing a Sea Teeming With Sonic Treasures
